description: The film promotes the use of fire-resistant materials in the manufacture and purchase of children's clothing and especially nightwear in the interests of child safety. Shot at the Royal Children's Hospital, Melbourne, it shows children being brought in by ambulance and their treatment for burns and scalds, including skin grafting; also interviews by the surgeons with the parents about their children's accidents. Co-produced with the Australian Wool Corporation and the Royal Children's Hospital, Melbourne.
